page.title: 15EMPLOYMENT:A HULL SURVEY
page.content: In a survey of children in our school, we discovered that many more had fathers who were in full-time employment than mothers. 50% of the children had a father in full-time employment - only 12% had a mother so employed. 6% had both parents in full- time work. Most part-time workers were mothers - 40% of all children asked had a Mum who worked part-time compared to 6% of Dads. 21% had a Dad who worked full-time and a Mum who worked part-time. 10% of Dads were unemployed compared to 6% of Mums. Another 10% said that their Dad did not work, whereas 34% said that Mum did not work.
